column1: -mar is a Quenya suffix that has three meanings.

column4: p.64 Although Angmar is a Sindarin name
column5: the Quenya suffix -mar and the Sindarin suffix -bar come from the same root

column1: Used for the residence of a family
column2: the whole area occupied or owned by a family or kindred. Also used with a defining genitive or in genitival compound. When added to a personal name (e.g. Ingwemar) it signified the residence of a family of which the head was the named person. After the name of a people of kindred (e.g. Eldamar) it referred to the whole area occupied or owned by them
column3: in which their dwellings or houses were distributed and in which they were settled and were at home as long as they remained as united people.

column1: (from Root MBAR settle) Used for a region settled/ inhabited by a people
column3: p.164 An example would be Eldamar (elda + mar)
